question: What is C++?
options: a) C++ is an object oriented programming language
b) C++ is a procedural programming language
c) C++ supports both procedural and object oriented programming language
d) C++ is a functional programming language
answer: c) C++ supports both procedural and object oriented programming language

question: Which of the following is the correct syntax of including a user defined header file in C++?
Which of the following is used for comments in C++?
Which of the following extension is used for user-defined header file in C++?
Which of the following is a correct identifier in C++?
Which of the following is not a type of Constructor in C++?
Which of the following approach is used by C++?
What is virtual inheritance in C++?
options: a) C++ technique to enhance multiple inheritance
b) C++ technique to ensure that a private member of the base class can be accessed somehow
c) C++ technique to avoid multiple inheritances of classes
d) C++ technique to avoid multiple copies of the base class into children/derived class
answer: d) C++ technique to avoid multiple copies of the base class into children/derived class

options: a) The program is not semantically correct
b) The program is compiled and executed successfully
c) The program gives a compile-time error
d) The program compiled successfully but throws an error during run-time
answer: b) The program is compiled and executed successfully
